multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have itchy blisters on my ears that have been there for a week.
Have these blisters appeared anywhere else on your body?
No, the blisters are only on my ears.
Do you currently have any chronic diseases, such as diabetes or an autoimmune disorder?
No, I don't have any chronic diseases like diabetes or an autoimmune disorder.
Have you recently changed any of your personal care products, such as shampoo, soap, or lotions?
No, I haven't used any particular products on my ears before the rash appeared.
Do you have any known allergies?
No, I don't have any known allergies.
Have you been exposed to any new environments or substances, like plants or chemicals, before the blisters appeared?
I recently returned from spring break with my family, but I didn't mention any specific new exposures.
Were you exposed to sunlight during your spring break more than usual?
I didn't specifically mention sunlight exposure, but I did say that the blisters appear yearly around the same time, after spring break.
Final Diagnosis: Polymorphic Light Eruption (PMLE)
